paragraphs.text: %md ## Explicit Semantic Analysis (ESA) for Text Analytics Explicit Semantic Analysis (ESA) supports unsupervised learning for feature extraction of explicit features based on an existing knowledge base, and supervised learning for classification. It is the process of understanding the meaning of a section of text as a combination of the concepts found in the text. Compared to other techniques such as Latent Dirichlet Association (LDA) or Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF), ESA offers some unique benefits. Most notably, it improves text document categorization by calculating `semantic relatedness` (how similar in meaning two words or pieces of text are to each other) between the documents and a set of topics that are explicitly defined and described by humans. The Oracle Machine Learning for Python function *oml.esa* extracts text-based features from a corpus of documents and performs document similarity comparisons. All processing occurs inside Oracle Autonomous Database. In this notebook, we'll use the Wikipedia Model as an example: - Create an OML4Py proxy ESA model object for the pre-loaded Wikipedia model - Examples of using the Wiki ESA model - Basic ESA Wiki model features for words - Basic ESA Wiki model features for phrases - ESA Wiki Model document similarity on phrases - ESA Wiki Model document similarity on long phrases Copyright (c) 2022 Oracle Corporation ###### The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0 ---

msg.data:
Explicit Semantic Analysis (ESA) for Text Analytics

Explicit Semantic Analysis (ESA) supports unsupervised learning for feature extraction of explicit features based on an existing knowledge base, and supervised learning for classification. It is the process of understanding the meaning of a section of text as a combination of the concepts found in the text. Compared to other techniques such as Latent Dirichlet Association (LDA) or Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF), ESA offers some unique benefits. Most notably, it improves text document categorization by calculating semantic relatedness (how similar in meaning two words or pieces of text are to each other) between the documents and a set of topics that are explicitly defined and described by humans.

The Oracle Machine Learning for Python function oml.esa extracts text-based features from a corpus of documents and performs document similarity comparisons. All processing occurs inside Oracle Autonomous Database.

In this notebook, we'll use the Wikipedia Model as an example:

  • Create an OML4Py proxy ESA model object for the pre-loaded Wikipedia model
  • Examples of using the Wiki ESA model
  • Basic ESA Wiki model features for words
  • Basic ESA Wiki model features for phrases
  • ESA Wiki Model document similarity on phrases
  • ESA Wiki Model document similarity on long phrases

Copyright (c) 2022 Oracle Corporation

The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0

paragraphs.title: Delete existing policies and create new policies for the Wiki Lexer
paragraphs.text:
%python

# Should be executed in a separate session, otherwise it will not work
# Specify settings for the Policy
cur = cursor()
cur.execute("BEGIN ctx_ddl.drop_policy('wiki_txtpol'); EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN NULL; END;")
cur.execute("BEGIN ctx_ddl.drop_preference( 'wiki_lexer'); EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN NULL; END;")
cur.execute("BEGIN ctx_ddl.create_preference('wiki_lexer', 'BASIC_LEXER'); END;")
cur.execute("BEGIN ctx_ddl.set_attribute('wiki_lexer', 'INDEX_STEMS', 'ENGLISH'); END;")
cur.execute("BEGIN ctx_ddl.create_policy(policy_name => 'wiki_txtpol', lexer => 'wiki_lexer'); END;")
cur.close()

%md ### The model was pre-loaded to the Oracle Autonomous Database because it is a large 800 MB model object. #### Follow the Setup from Oracle blogs: 1. New Wikipedia-Based Cognitive Model Available for Text Processing blog post 2. Text Analytics using a pre-built Wikipedia-based Topic Model blog post 3. Explicit Semantic Analysis (ESA) for Text Analytics blog post We need to create the proxy for the existing model into OML4Py - If the model is available on the same user, you can use the code: In Python: "esa_wiki_mod = oml.esa(model_name = 'in-db wiki modelname') " - If the model is available on a different schema, you need to: 1. Run as SYSDBA a "grant execute on model to or public" in sql; then 2. In Python "esa_wiki_mod = oml.esa(model_name = 'in-db wiki modelname', model_owner = 'model owner schema name') "

msg.data:
The model was pre-loaded to the Oracle Autonomous Database because it is a large 800 MB model object.

Follow the Setup from Oracle blogs:

  1. New Wikipedia-Based Cognitive Model Available for Text Processing blog post
  2. Text Analytics using a pre-built Wikipedia-based Topic Model blog post
  3. Explicit Semantic Analysis (ESA) for Text Analytics blog post

We need to create the proxy for the existing model into OML4Py

  • If the model is available on the same user, you can use the code:
    In Python: “esa_wiki_mod = oml.esa(model_name = 'in-db wiki modelname') "
  • If the model is available on a different schema, you need to:
    1. Run as SYSDBA a “grant execute on model to or public” in sql; then
    2. In Python “esa_wiki_mod = oml.esa(model_name = 'in-db wiki modelname', model_owner = 'model owner schema name') "

paragraphs.title: News on Nasa Rover and SpaceX Moon Gateway using ESA Wikipedia model
paragraphs.text:
%python

temp_pd = oml.push(pd.DataFrame({'TEXT':['NASA Perseverance Mars rover closed in on the red planet after a journey of 293 million miles, hurtling toward a nail-biting seven-minute descent to touchdown Thursday. The mission is an unprecedented attempt to find signs of past microbial life at the site of an ancient martian river, delta and lakebed. Mission managers at NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California, said Wednesday that the spacecraft, still attached to its interplanetary cruise stage, is healthy and flawlessly executing its final approach to Jezero Crater.',
    'NASA has selected SpaceX to deliver the first two segments of the moon-orbiting Gateway space station for its upcoming Artemis program, which aims to put astronauts back on the moon. The elements will launch atop a Falcon Heavy rocket, sometime in 2024. The flight, which is the second to be awarded to SpaceX this week will carry the Gateway''s power and habitation modules.  Once deposited in lunar orbit, the Gateway will serve as an outpost for astronauts and equipment heading to the moon as part of NASA Artemis program. Roughly one-sixth the size of the International Space Station, the Gateway will support research investigations, crew, and expeditions to the lunar surface.']}))
z.show(esa_wiki_mod.feature_compare(temp_pd,
                                    compare_cols = ['TEXT']))
